remarks: Heron's formula gives the area of a triangle given only the side lengths.  If points A, B, C form a triangle, then the area of the triangle, represented here as ` ( 1 / 2 ) x. X x. Y x. abs ( sin O ) ` , is equal to the square root of ` S x. ( S - X ) x. ( S - Y ) x. ( S - Z ) ` , where ` S = ( X + Y + Z ) / 2 ` is half the perimeter of the triangle.  Based on work by Jon Pennant.  This is Metamath 100 proof #57.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Mar-2019.)
